name: cambrian
content:
Cambrian adjective
(TIME)
Add to word list
Add to word list
geology
  specialized from or referring to the period of time between about 543 and 490 million years ago, in which many different types of invertebrates (= animals with no back bone) first appeared: These rocks date from the middle of the Cambrian era. They are already present in early Cambrian rocks.
More examplesFewer examplesNow nobody can deny that life back in the Cambrian era was already extremely varied.When we consider another event of the Cambrian period, an interesting parallel emerges.The evidence fitted, but there was something of a gap between the first eye and the Cambrian explosion event.

Cambrian adjective
(WELSH)
used in place names to mean Welsh: The Cambrian Coast stretches from Cardigan in the south to Harlech and Porthmadog in the north. the Cambrian Mountains
More examplesFewer examplesThe Gallery is on Cambrian Place in Swansea.The Talyllyn Railway was built to connect the slate quarries above Abergynolwyn with the Cambrian Railway at Towyn.

the Cambrian
the Cambrian period (= the period between about 543 and 490 million years ago): Highly complex plants and animals evolved in the Cambrian. Conodonts are small fossils found in rocks ranging in age from the Cambrian to the Triassic.
More examplesFewer examplesThey explored quarries where 500-million-year-old fossils from the Cambrian had been found. The fossil jellyfish in the Burgess shale were thriving by the middle of the Cambrian.Just before the Cambrian, the deep oceans were made oxygen rich and sulfide poor by an unusual spate of undersea landslides.
